description.p2: 8th National Sculpture Biennial of San Antonio de Ibarra BINESAI
description.p3: is a great exhibition of art that has as its mission to make visible and strengthen the sculptural legacy of Ecuador. This project, to be held in 2025, aims to gather the main exponents of contemporary sculpture,
description.p4: promoting the dialogue between generations and the cultural exchange
description.p5: between artists, students, master artists and the community. San Antonio de Ibarra, recognized for its sculptural tradition, will be the epicenter of this gathering that reunites art, culture and heritage, encouraging the creation of new forms and techniques in contemporary sculpture.

dosier.text: All activities of the Biennial are free and open to the public.

objective1.title: Visibilizing the Ecuadorian contemporary art
objective1.description: Spreading the contemporary artistic proposals of national creators, strengthening their presence at the local and national level.

objective2.title: Fostering education and cultural exchange
objective2.description: Creating a space for students, master artists, and established artists to share their sculptural projects with the public.

objective3.title: Promoting the cultural heritage of San Antonio de Ibarra
objective3.description: Putting on the artistic and sculptural traditions of the region, linking the community and attracting cultural tourism through routes and open spaces.

hito1.title: National Sculpture Contest
hito1.description: Ecuadorian artists will compete to showcase their best sculptural proposals in the contemporary sculpture field.

hito2.title: First National Sculpture Contest for Students of Universities and Art Institutes
hito2.description: Space for young talented artists to share their sculptural projects with the public.

hito3.title: First Maestro Artesano of Imbabura Meeting
hito3.description: A tribute to the artistic tradition, strengthening the transmission of knowledge between masters and new generations.

hito4.title: Cultural Mediation
hito4.description: Specialized workshops, dialogues, and conversations to foster reflection around sculpture and contemporary art.

hito5.title: Itinerant History of the Biennial Exhibition
hito5.description: Walking through the most notable works of the past editions, bringing the Ecuadorian contemporary art to new audiences.

hito6.title: Open Routes and Open Spaces
hito6.description: Specialized workshops, dialogues, and conversations to foster reflection around sculpture and contemporary art.

impacto1.title: Cultural and Economic Development
impacto1.description: The event strengthens the local identity and promotes cultural tourism in San Antonio de Ibarra.

impacto2.title: Education and Promotion of Young Talents
impacto2.description: Fostering intergenerational dialogue between acclaimed artists and emerging artists.

impacto3.title: International Visibility
impacto3.description: The BINESAI positions Ecuador as a reference to the contemporary sculpture in the global context.

beneficio1.title: Brand Visibility / Institution
beneficio1.description: Exposure to a diverse and committed audience, both traditional and digital.

beneficio2.title: Association with the Art and Culture
beneficio2.description: Connection to an event that celebrates the artistic and cultural heritage.

beneficio3.title: Networking Opportunities
beneficio3.description: Access to a network of artists, critics, cultural authorities, and leaders of the community.

member1.name: María López
member1.title: CEO & Founder
member1.description: Expert in leadership and strategic vision.

member3.name: Ana García
member3.title: Graphic Designer
member3.description: Transforms ideas into visually stunning experiences.

member4.name: Carlos Gómez
member4.title: Marketing Specialist
member4.description: Creates strategies that connect brands with people.

form.title: Inscription
form.description: Register to participate in the National Sculpture Biennial
